comments.commentBody:
what if I am not a true progressive who wouldn't vote for Hillary or Elizabeth?

What to do?

i'm interested in hearing about those "more lucrative ways".

2 questions:
1. from where will the funds come to pay hillary's campaign staff?
2. just curious...do bill and hillary still have the 6.000+ sq. ft. "perk" penthouse built for them atop the clinton presidential library?
It's easy to be philanthropic when it's someone else's money.
The Clinton Foundation is a 501(c)(3) tax free organization.  I wonder how much scrutiny they got from the IRS.
And the Carters.  President Carter recently said that democracy was dead in America.  Funny how no US media covered it.  But Der Spiegel did.  And I agree with him.
Yes old-fashioned politics can get very gooey, I agree!
They could build houses like the Carters.

Why would you think she was different?  She completely mismanaged her run for the nomination, losing control big-time, allowing Mark Penn to do a very poor job.  But she felt entitled and thought for sure she had it.  She blew it big time.

Thank you, J Roush, for stating my position.  For all their weaknesses, the Clintons have devoted their lives -- and now Chelsea is following suit -- to helping others.  For all those who want to tear them down, compare what they have done with what you have done.  Let those without sin throw the first stone (and I am not religious).
I am a lifelong democrat but no way could I cast a ballot for gold diggers.

I can answer that for you - although it's surprising anyone thinks he needs to ask such a question. They are two people committed heart and soul to making people's lives better. I know this personally from years of friendship, years of working for and with them, and years of observation. They work themselves and teams of people half their ages into exhaustion for the causes they believe in. They used to greet staff (maybe still do) by asking, "What are you doing today to make people's lives better?" Try to imagine anyone in the Bush admin EVER asking a question like that.

So, if you want perfection I guess you need to look elsewhere, but if what you want is brilliance, creativity and endless dedication to building a better future for your kids and grandkids, Bill, Hillary and Chelsea will work their hearts out for you.

This is an easy one for the right to jump on, but what is really interesting are the number on the left defending the corruption from the Clinton's.  All in the name of helping the poor.  Really?  I'm pretty sure that's what the current administration set out to do, and the very people they've pledged to help, they've hurt the most.  How about if we hold ALL politicians accountable for corruption......regardless of party, gender, race, etc.?  Then perhaps those easily dismissed by the right, and cheated by the left,  just may have half a chance at a better life!

---"Fringe elements?" The MB  apparently represents close to half of Egyptian citizens. Whether one agrees with them or not, since WHEN is it okay to "break up" encampments (composed of over half women and children) with gunfire?

Appeasement policy kills again...

I disagree with some comments. Yes, it was not unexpected what happened. But to say its the Muslim Brotherhoods own fault that they now get killed? Because they did (a disturbing but peaceful) occupying sit-in of central squares? Thats extremely cynical. Just think about that: what if Occupy Wall street sit-in participants would have been killed because they didn't negotiate, didn't compromise? We see how absurd this is.

If somebody is at fault, then it is the indecisive and coward appeasement policy of the US and the European allies who all have not even now the courage to call the events what they are: a coup! A coup in its purest and worst form. Killing of hundreds if soon not thousands of opponents, keeping (the one year ago democratically elected) president Morsi in prison for blurred reasons.

What makes it even worse: The US get bloody hands right now, as they still keep supporting the military dictatorship with billion dollar military aid. For weapons right now in use against the other half of Egypt.
But of course its still not a coup. Right Mister President?
Right. And you would have recommended the same treatment be meted out to the "Occupy Wall Street" protesters -- a fringe element if there was one -- too, I guess.

This is an interesting and humane comment. If Mayor Filner is indeed showing early signs of dementia, his problems will continue long after his eventual resignation. Come to think of it, the elderly man who forces himself on females and has relatives who try to control his behavior and warn against getting in his clutches is a familiar figure in folklore for a reason.

You do not "establish conditions" for democracy by massacring protesters who are staging a sit-in.

By doing that, you are establishing conditions for a brutally repressive dictatorship.

"Our immigration policies should be solely about doing what is best for the American public. Such policies should not be about adhering to the desires of a specific ethnic group for race based power."

Tell it to the GOP, which is having some trouble accepting that their long-term strategy of pandering to white racists has put them in a shrinking little corner.

As someone who works in the field I can tell you that the issues are deeper than that.

First, doctors make 2-3x in the U.S. what they make in the rest of the world. Second, you are paying here for all the hi tech equipment, the expensive drugs, and the lavish hospital rooms that just don't exist to the same degree elsewhere. The American public needs to change its understanding of what good healthcare means.

"Is time for belligerent countries in the region to talk."

Uziel, this will not occur today, tomorrow or in the future and deep down you know this. Better yet "we" should just simply accept it. There is no reverence for life in this region of the world and they, all parties involved, have all agreed to fight it out, down and to the last glowing ember.

It's time for the USA to disengage and withdraw and to face that which is inescapably destiny for all involved, and that is that these are primitive tribal cultures when all is said and done and they possess a very high inner critic and a low thinking or logos function and are programmed for war and destruction of one another. It's also been going on long before you or I were even born into this world.

My advice too *all* of the young is to flee and to do so quickly ASAP if all at possible and raise and educate yourselves and your families elsewhere in the West and don't look back.
They are not fringe elements, they were the democratically elected government of Egypt before they were deposed through a military coup.

There is a very great difference between a "worst case scenario" and a prediction. Look it up and I bet you find out I'm right. Moreover, the context for the first quote was October 2003. At that time, the United States had become the first country to embark on two foreign wars while cutting taxes.

What is MMT? The Taylor rule of ten years ago? The empty box that has nothing to say about a liquidity trap since such a thing was never contemplated? The meanderings of Rand Paul's disorganized mind?
sovereign governments issue bonds and sell them for cash, this is borrowing.

The FED has never controlled rates. It sets the discount rate at which it lends, but that is very different from setting rates.

Of course Krugman said that a sovereign government with its own currency is different from Greece. Everyone with a baseball cap said that. No one had a model that said otherwise.
Ted, You are welcome.  It makes  my day when I can be helpful.

You think killing thousands of protesters staging a sit-in is "good"?

That those protesters were anti-America (anti-Israel) justifies murdering them?

On your logic the U.S. (or Israel) should simply exterminate the whole lot.

What is being killed is any support America may have had among Muslims in the Middle East.

None of the Occupy Wall Street protesters were shot to death.

What are you talking about.
